# isIndeterminate

**Instance Property**

A Boolean that indicates whether the progress indicator is indeterminate.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var isIndeterminate: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

A determinate indicator displays how much of the task has been completed. An indeterminate indicator shows simply that the app is busy.

When the value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], the progress indicator is indeterminate; otherwise, it is determinate.

## Setting the appearance

- **controlSize**: The size of the progress indicator.
- **controlTint**: The progress indicator’s control tint.
- **isBezeled**: A Boolean that indicates whether the progress indicator’s frame has a three-dimensional bezel.
- **style**: The style of the progress indicator (bar or spinning).
- **sizeToFit()**: This action method resizes the progress indicator to an appropriate size depending on the value of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSProgressIndicator/style-swift.property].
- **isDisplayedWhenStopped**: A Boolean that indicates whether the progress indicator hides itself when it isn’t animating.
